SummaryEnglish: Aya Tachibana is a sixth-grader who frets and obsesses over friends, family, grades, and more. One day, she joins the "Tantei Team KZ" with four very idiosyncratic boys she met at cram school. There is the glib and attention-grabbing leader Kazuomi Wakatake, the mysterious "expert of personal relationships" Takakazu Kuroki, the smart and stoic math genius Kazunori Uesugi, and the sweet-hearted Kazuhiko Kozuka who is good at social matters and science. Aya finds her place among them as the "language expert." "Tantei Team KZ" gets involved in modern-day cases, and even if they bicker from time to time, they collaborate by pooling each of their talents and skills to solve these cases.

1.SummaryEnglish:
Sixth-grader Tachibana Aya has no friends. One day, she's called into a special class at cram school, where she meets a group of studious, athletic and unique boys.
 
 
▽ Kieta jitensha wa shitteiru sono 1 [Japan: original Romaji title]
▽ The Missing Bicycle Knows Part 1 [Japan: literal English translation]
▽ The Missing Bike Knows: Part 1 [Int'l: renamed English title]

2.SummaryEnglish:
Aya and the gang investigate the disappearance of Wakatake's bike.
 
 
▽ Kieta jitensha wa shitteiru sono 2 [Japan: original Romaji title]
▽ The Missing Bicycle Knows Part 2 [Japan: literal English translation]
▽ The Missing Bike Knows: Part 2 [Int'l: renamed English title]

3.SummaryEnglish:
Aya and the gang find Wakatake's bicycle wrecked.
 
 
▽ Kieta jitensha wa shitteiru sono 3 [Japan: original Romaji title]
▽ The Missing Bicycle Knows Part 3 [Japan: literal English translation]
▽ The Missing Bike Knows: Part 3 [Int'l: renamed English title]

4.SummaryEnglish:
The group figures out who stole the bike, but Aya isn't convinced they should take matters into their own hands.
 
 
▽ Kieta jitensha wa shitteiru sono 4 [Japan: original Romaji title]
▽ The Missing Bicycle Knows Part 4 [Japan: literal English translation]
▽ The Missing Bike Knows: Part 4 [Int'l: renamed English title]
